text: a horrific attack in a usually quiet
corner of southern Germany emergency
teams dealt with the aftermath for
several hours after a young man armed
with an axe and a knife brought terror
to a suburban train one witness said the
scene in the carriage was like a
slaughterhouse some 30 passengers were
on board when the 17 year old began his
attack at least four people were injured
- from Hong Kong are said to be in a
critical condition several others were
treated at the scene for shock the
attacker then fled from the train but
was shot and killed as he tried to make
his escape yeah would had done we were
lucky that by chance we had some special
police forces in the area who then
chased the perpetrator he was stopped
with any attacks and policeman's inside
there was no other option but to shoot
this morning the young man's body was
taken away he's been identified as an
Afghan asylum seeker who'd been living
with a foster family in a town nearby
the authorities suggest the attack may
have been inspired by so-called Islamic
state yeah Sunday yes the note in the
first emergency call from the train a
witness said the attacker shouted Allahu
Akbar a hand-drawn Islamic state flag
was later found in his room police are
investigating there's evidence but there
are no known links to anyone else this
crime scene remains under investigation
the bloody remnants of trauma packs
still lies scattered on the ground
attacks linked to Islamic extremism are
unusual in Germany
police warn it's hard to keep people
safe from this kind of threat Richard
Lister BBC News
